channel.title: Can someone help with im sure is an "easy fix"
channel.description:
Okay so im trying to just get my own RSPS set up but im having some difficulty getting it going. Like for instance i know how to change the ip and set all the JDK1's to the updated numbers but as far as getting the server+client to run together is hard. It says complete and running server but when i go to run client nothing happens :o
So if anyone know's what im doing wrong please share/help with me so i can fix it.
Side Note: Last possible solution is teamviewer (if you have the time) because id rather learn how to do it myself.
Thanks in advance :)

item.title: Can someone help with im sure is an "easy fix"
item.dc:creator: @sakumari sakumari
item.description:
@sakumari wrote:

Is the cache fixed? if there’s a cache download from where u downloaded it, download that and replace it with the files that are already there if there is some. ( It’s supposed to be in C/: )

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone help with im sure is an "easy fix"

item.title: Can someone help with im sure is an "easy fix"
item.dc:creator: @kingcobra805 kingcobra805
item.description:
@kingcobra805 wrote:

heres some possible problems…

  1. you did not port forward.
  2. You didnt change the ip’s to yours…
  3. The world is going to end and you sir are fucked.

Lmao.

Read full topic

item.title: Can someone help with im sure is an "easy fix"
item.dc:creator: @Dyl4n20 Dyl4n20
item.description:
@Dyl4n20 wrote:

Make sure you compile and re run the client after you edit your IP into the client.java or GUI depending on what base. If this still results in error connecting to server , your server is offline and it has nothing to do with your client/source.

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone help with im sure is an "easy fix"

  • when you say that nothing happens when you run the client, what do you mean? Does the client even open up? Does a CMD prompt show up?
